psl2psl.py - manipulate psl files¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Purpose¶

This script reads alignments in psl format, applies one ore more operations on them and then outputs them again in psl.

The following operators are available:

merge
merges psl alignments between overlapping entries of query/target
in a file. Merging is stopped on query/target and/or strand change. This script will check for overlaps and will take the longest path through a set of overlapping paths.
map
map alignments. Similar to mapPsl, but will apply a map to both query and target. This method requires the two options filter-query and filter-target. Intervals are given in gff or gtf format. In the latter case, the alignment is threaded through the exons.
filter-keep
filter alignments. Only parts of the alignments are kept that are part of the intervals.
filter-remove
filter alignments. Only parts of the alignments are kept that are not part of the intervals.
complement
complement a psl sequence. For example this will convert exons to introns. If an entry contains only a single exon, it is omitted.
select-longest
select only the longest transcript (nmatches)
rename-query
rename matches (query) consecutively.
test
go through file and remove all non-parseable lines
sanitize
change query/target names according to fasta sequence database
remove-overlapping-query
remove all alignments that are not unique with respect to query segment (requires alignments to be sorted by query)
remove-overlapping-target
remove all alignments that are not unique with respect to a target segment (requires alignments to be sorted by target)

Usage¶

Example:

python <script_name>.py --help

Type:

python <script_name>.py --help

for command line help.

Command line options¶

Usage: psl2psl.py [options]

Options:
  --version             show program's version number and exit
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --no-usage            output help without usage information
  --filter-query=FILENAME_FILTER_QUERY
                        filename with intervals in the query to filter (in gff
                        format) [default=none].
  --filter-target=FILENAME_FILTER_TARGET
                        filename with intervals in the target to filter (in
                        gff format) [default=none].
  -m METHODS, --method=METHODS
                        action to perform [default=[]].
  --select=SELECT       entry to select [default=most-nmatches].
  --header=HEADER       output psl header [default=none].
  --format=FORMAT       format of intervals [default=gff].
  --filename-queries=FILENAME_QUERIES
                        fasta filename with queries.
  --filename-target=FILENAME_SBJCTS
                        fasta filename with sbjct [default=none].
  --id-format=ID_FORMAT
                        format of new identifiers for the rename function
                        [default=%06i].
  --unique              in the rename function, make each match unique
                        [default=False].
  --output-filename-map=OUTPUT_FILENAME_MAP
                        filename with map of old to new labels for rename
                        function [default=none].
  --complement-min-length=COMPLEMENT_MIN_LENGTH
                        minimum length for complemented blocks [default=none].
  --complement-border=COMPLEMENT_BORDER
                        number of residues to exclude before alignment at
                        either end [default=none].
  --complement-aligner=COMPLEMENT_ALIGNER
                        aligner for complemented segments [default=none].
  --threshold-merge-distance=THRESHOLD_MERGE_DISTANCE
                        distance in nucleotides at which two adjacent reads
                        shall be merged even if they are not overlapping [0].
  --test=TEST           for debugging purposes - stop after x iterations
                        [default=none].
  -v LOGLEVEL, --verbose=LOGLEVEL
                        loglevel [1]. The higher, the more output.
  --timeit=TIMEIT_FILE  store timeing information in file [none].
  --timeit-name=TIMEIT_NAME
                        name in timing file for this class of jobs [all].
  --timeit-header       add header for timing information [none].
  --random-seed=RANDOM_SEED
                        random seed to initialize number generator with
                        [none].
  -I FILE, --stdin=FILE
                        file to read stdin from [default = stdin].
  -L FILE, --log=FILE   file with logging information [default = stdout].
  -E FILE, --error=FILE
                        file with error information [default = stderr].
  -S FILE, --stdout=FILE
                        file where output is to go [default = stdout].
